main_definition: The Mediterranean refers to the sea bordered by southern Europe, north Africa, and southwest Asia, as well as its associated cultural aspects such as food, climate, and people.

meanings_and_examples.example: The Mediterranean Sea is a large body of water that connects Europe, Africa, and Asia.
Mediterranean climate typically refers to mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers characteristic of the regions surrounding the Mediterranean Sea.
The geographic location of countries like Spain, Italy, Greece, Turkey, Egypt, Israel, Palestine, and Libya makes them part of the Mediterranean region.
Mediterranean cuisine is known for its emphasis on fresh vegetables, fruits, grains, nuts, olive oil, and seafood.
The Mediterranean region has a rich history of diverse people and cultures, including Greeks, Romans, Arabs, and many more.
